newsitem.title: USA: VLSI Technology to Sell COMPASS unit.
newsitem.headline: VLSI Technology to Sell COMPASS unit.

text.p: VLSI Technology Inc and Avant Corp said on Thursday that VLSI agreed to sell its COMPASS Design Automation subsidiary to Avant for $44 million in cash and stock.
COMPASS makes software for the design of semiconductors.
The transaction is expected to close by the end of the current quarter, the companies said in separate statements.
VLSI said it will focus on its semiconductor business.
Avant said COMPASS will be useful in its development of software for system-on-a-chip systems.
A VLSI spokesman said COMPASS was losing money, but it was in a situation where COMPASS's potential customers, namely semiconductor makers, did not want to do business with a competitor.
